step1.sentence: They took a wrong turn and ended up on the other side of the city.

step2.story: He applied for one small role at the theater company just to try something new. Three years later, he ended up as the lead director of the annual festival.

step3.story: Clara had planned a quiet weekend at home with no plans and no obligations. But a friend called with a spare ticket to a folk concert, and she said yes almost without thinking. They grabbed food from a street vendor, found a spot on the grass, and ended up staying until the last song. It was one of those evenings she had not seen coming at all.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 의도하지 않았거나 예상치 못한 상황이나 상태에 결국 이르다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 계획과 다르게 어떤 결과나 상황에 도달했을 때 씁니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: end(끝나다)와 up(결과 도달)이 결합하여 어떤 과정의 끝에 특정 상태에 이른다는 의미가 되었습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 의도와 관계없이 어떤 결과로 귀결되는 상황을 묘사합니다. 뒤에 동명사나 형용사가 자주 옵니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: We missed the last bus and ended up walking home.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 막차를 놓쳐서 결국 걸어서 집에 왔어요.
